miic.core.macro.vchange_estimate_multi_ref¶

vchange_estimate_multi_ref(base_dir, suffix, save_dir, center_win_len, fmax, fmin, order, fs, smooth_win, tw_start, tw_len, st_range, st_steps, list_of_combinations, all, multi_ref_freq, use_breakpoint, breakpoint, old_style=False, parallel=True)[source]¶

Velocity change estimation macro.

This function, starting from the whole set of correlation matrix created for a defined dataset, evaluate the velocity change doing a simple pre-processing:

bandpass filtering and smoothing.
Parameters:
  • base_dir (string) – Where the corr matrix are stored
  • suffix (string) – Optional suffix for the filename (it must be the same used with the recombine_corr_data function through with the corr matrix were saved)
  • save_dir (string) – Where all the velocity change traces and the corresponding corr traces will be saved.
  • center_win_len (int) – How many samples will be taken from the central part of the corr func
  • fmax (float) – Maximum freq for the bandpass filter
  • fmin (float) – Minimum freq for the bandpass filter
  • order (int) – Filter order (i.e. corners in obspy terminology)
  • fs (float) – Sampling frequency for the corr trace
  • smooth_win (int) – Width of the smoothing window
  • tw_start_list (list of int) – List of time lag (in samples) that we want to adopt in the velocity change evaluation
  • tw_len (int) – Time window length in samples for each time lag
  • st_range (float) – Stretching range (i.e. 0.01 -> 1%)
  • st_steps (int) – How many stretching steps in the specified range
  • list_of_combinations (string) – The list of combinations that we want to plot (e.g. [‘QC01-QC02’,’QC05-QC11’]
  • all (bool) – If true all possible combinations will be calculated
  • old_style (bool) – If true, the suffic is generated using the fs ( “_<fs>Hz”) instead of being passed as a parameter)
  • parallel (bool) – if true it tries to use as much cores as are available to do the computation
